name: Southern Cassowary
description: The Southern Cassowary is a large, flightless bird with a vibrant casque and powerful legs.
spread_note: Found in New Guinea and northern Australia.
reproduction: Lays 3-8 eggs in a ground nest, males incubate for about 50 days.
attractions: Striking in zoos due to their size and colorful appearance.
projects_note: Endangered due to habitat loss; conservation programs are active.
breeding: Bred in captivity to support population recovery.
